page.title: 12BELLINGHAM AUCTION MART.
page.content: The mart which is a meeting place for local farmers has been in existence for many years.It is important to the people of the North Tyne and Redesdale,not only for buying and selling sheep and cattle,but for the social contact it gives.Buyers come from as far afield as Cumbria,Scotland and Lincolnshire. There are about ten or twelve marts per year,selling both cattle and sheep.There are two rings which makes things much easier when both sheep and cattle are being sold. At the end of May there is also a furniture sale,which is one of the highlights of the year for many local people.On Friday- viewing- evening the rings are packed with people,all looking for a bargain.The most recent use for the ring was a production of a play by the local Dramatic Society.
